definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to be stranded (of ship)/to run aground/fig. to run into difficulties and stop
to put down the pen/to stop writing
to run aground in mid-course/to run into difficulty and stop
variant of 耽擱|耽搁[dan1 ge5]

sentences.english: You put too much salt in this dish.
sentences.chinese: 这菜里你盐搁得太多了。

sentences.english: Chickens also died from the lack of temperature control.
sentences.chinese: 搁有，鸡仔因为温度箱峘无法度控制嘛拢死去。

sentences.english: Tilt the proofer at a 45 degree angle resting the rubber roll on the substrate.
sentences.chinese: 倾斜45度角搁在基板上的胶辊打样机。

sentences.english: Square timber joists form the base layer and are laid across the span of the structure.
sentences.chinese: 方木搁栅形成的基础层，是整个结构的跨度奠定。

sentences.english: The transverse diaphragm is very similar in appearance to the conventional bar joist.
sentences.chinese: 横梁很相似于通常的钢筋搁栅。

sentences.english: He had taken a chair and had sat down by the bed, leaning one arm on the coverlet .
sentences.chinese: 他搬了一把椅子，坐到床边，把一只胳膊搁在被子上。

sentences.english: I put the veal scallops into the refrigerator before they could spoil.
sentences.chinese: 在小牛肉可能变质前，我把它们搁在冰箱里。

sentences.english: She sat in the sofa with her legs propping on a small stool.
sentences.chinese: 她坐在沙发上，双腿搁在一张小凳上。

sentences.english: He placed his cap and overcoat on a chair.
sentences.chinese: 他把帽子和大衣搁在一张椅子上。

sentences.english: I cooked it over a fire or dried it in the sun .
sentences.chinese: 我把它架在火上烤或搁在太阳下晒干。

sentences.english: All our capital is locked up in that enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 我们的资金全部搁死在那个企业了。

sentences.english: The buddha's tooth installs in a golden box, puts in a temple top layer darkroom.
sentences.chinese: 佛牙装在一个金盒子中，搁在庙的顶层一个暗室里。

sentences.english: Pick up your socks and put them in the laundry basket.
sentences.chinese: 把你的袜子拣伏回，搁到洗衣篮表。

sentences.english: Mom spoiled the soup with too much salt.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈搁了太多的盐，把汤给弄糟了。

sentences.english: He finished the glass and plunked it down firmly on the table.
sentences.chinese: 喝完酒之后，他将玻璃杯重重地搁到桌上。

sentences.english: I knew I had to be strong, to put my sense of loss to one side and my feelings elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我必须坚强，把惘然和眷恋的情绪搁在一边。

definition: to put down/to leave behind/to throw or knock down/to abandon or discard
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/proximity/thread (of ideas, plots etc)/see also 邊|边[bian1]
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
edge (used directly after a noun, e.g. roadside 馬路沿兒|马路沿儿)
to lift/to carry in one's hand/Taiwan pr. [ling1]
to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
